content: this pattern is also available for free on my blog here 1 learn how to crochet the waffle stitch this deceptively easy stitch is comprised entirely of double crochets yes double crochets learn how to do front post double_crochet in the right places to give your blanket texture that pops this blanket would look beautiful without a border and i debated whether to add one but in the end i love the way the simple moss stitch border gives the blanket a polished finish i used cotton yarn for this project which is known to stretch easily so i figured a thick tightly woven border would give the blanket a bit more structure materials size 3 dk weight yarn approximately 1600 yards i used -4 cakes yarn bee sugarwheel cotton in citrus grove -1 cake yarn bee sugarwheel cotton solids in muted sage for border size 7/4 5mm crochet hook scissors tapestry needle for weaving in ends stitch markers the pattern links up for a video tutorial for how to do the waffle stitch and another video tutorial on the moss stitch border for visual learners 1 https //dananield com/2023/10/05/waffle-stitch-baby-blanket/
